programme.title: Con Express
Ekspres śmierci
Con Express
programme.desc: Con Express: Directed by Terry Cunningham. With Sean Patrick Flanery, Arnold Vosloo, Ursula Karven, Eyal Podell. Agent Brooks tells his side of a botched job at a job interview for for the Head of Customs in Alaska. He takes a tip that a shipment of bio-weaponry is coming in and discovers a Russian terrorist, Simeonov, is behind it. Brooks assembles a team and they go down to the docks to check the tip out. There a shoot-fest follows, an undercover FBI agent surfaces and a Russian agent, Natalya arrives to claim rights over Simeonov. Simeonov is arrested but while being transferred to Washington he escapes and with his fellow terrorists hijack the train carrying the stolen Russian nerve gas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0310907/","name":"Con Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NDEwOTU3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzc3NTQ5._V1_.jpg","description":"Agent Brooks tells his side of a botched job at a job interview for for the Head of Customs in Alaska. He takes a tip that a shipment of bio-weaponry is coming in and discovers a Russian terrorist, Simeonov, is behind it. Brooks asse","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0310907/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JimmyL5555"},"dateCreated":"2006-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"very weak action picture.....don't bother","reviewBody":"The entire movie is set in Flashback mode as an agent tells his superiors what happened in a Russian biochemical weapon terrorist transaction aboard a train that resulted in a huge folder of paperwork. The movie takes a while to get going, but once it does, you ride on the wave, and it doesn't get any faster than 2nd gear. Footage from the 1985 Eric Roberts' movie "Runaway Train" is used, and you kind of wish your were watching THAT movie instead. There is very little, if any, suspense, and it's a total waste of two hours. If you want to see this kind of story done well with edge-of-your-seat suspense, I'd recommend "Under Siege 2: Dark Territory" and "Atomic Train".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":462,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"2002-11-22","keywords":"hijack,train,die hard scenario,m16 gun,m 16","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Cons Express","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi599720217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0OGExYWMtMDYxOS00ZjMxLThjODctMWI3YjY2OTBkMThhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2I0OGExYWMtMDYxOS00ZjMxLThjODctMWI3YjY2OTBkMThhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001218/","name":"Sean Patrick Flanery"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0903677/","name":"Arnold Vosloo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440291/","name":"Ursula Karven"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192463/","name":"Terry Cunningham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0027550/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0083590/","name":"Paul A. programme.title: Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No
Rekinado 3: O rybia płetwa
Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!
programme.desc: Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!: Directed by Anthony C. Ferrante. With Ian Ziering, Tara Reid, Cassandra Scerbo, Frankie Muniz. A monstrous tornado unleashes ravenous sharks from Washington, D.C., all the way down to Orlando, Florida." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3899796/","name":"Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc5MDUzNzQzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDg4NTYzNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A monstrous tornado unleashes ravenous sharks from Washington, D.C., all the way down to Orlando, Florida.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3899796/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"keithlovesmovies"},"dateCreated":"2015-07-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Sharknado 3 Review","reviewBody":"Fin (Ian Ziering) and April (Tara Reid) are now remarried and are expecting another child. After a trip to Washington D.C. to receive a medal from current president Marcus Robbins (Marc Cuban) for his heroic actions during the events in the first 2 films, another sharknado strikes destroying the capital. Fearing that his family is in danger, he heads to Orlando. What he doesn't know is that a sharknado is following him while another is attacking Orlando. Now he and those he runs into on the way to Orlando must work together to try to stop the sharknados before they combine to form a sharkicane with the potential to destroy the entire East Coast.\n\nI'll get right to it and say that this movie is terrible but that's not the point here. Everyone probably knew this coming in so I don't think that I'm surprising anyone. The acting is bad, the special effects are bad to the point that they are laughable, and the story doesn't make any sense. I am aware that this movie is called Sharknado 3 so I wasn't expecting anything scientifically accurate. Sharks in space people!!!! I saw some things in this that made me question myself but like I've said, this film is called Sharknado 3 so in order to enjoy it, you just have to suspend belief and accept what you are being given. My favorite thing about the film is all the random shark kills in all their "semi-gory" glory (this is a TV movie so they can only go so far). You'll also be surprised by some of the people who get killed (no spoilers). Common sense would normally dictate not watching this but if you give it a chance you'll be pleasantly surprised and perhaps entertained as I was. I've seen the first 2 films and I enjoyed them a lot and I think that this one is the best one so far.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12465,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-07-22","keywords":"third part,creature feature,shark,space shuttle,nasa","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3641750297","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDFjYzAzMmItODRmMy00NWZjLWJkYjgtNmVjY2Y2ZDVlNDIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDFjYzAzMmItODRmMy00NWZjLWJkYjgtNmVjY2Y2ZDVlNDIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005575/","name":"Ian Ziering"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005346/","name":"Tara Reid"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2628561/","name":"Cassandra Scerbo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003116/","name":"Anthony C. Ferrante"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042909/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0705757/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505736/","name":"Thunder Levin"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

After a trip to Washington D.C. to receive a medal from current president Marcus Robbins (Marc Cuban) for his heroic actions during the events in the first 2 films, another sharknado strikes destroying the capital. Fearing that his family is in danger, he heads to Orlando. What he doesn't know is that a sharknado is following him while another is attacking Orlando. Now he and those he runs into on the way to Orlando must work together to try to stop the sharknados before they combine to form a sharkicane with the potential to destroy the entire East Coast.\n\nI'll get right to it and say that this movie is terrible but that's not the point here. Everyone probably knew this coming in so I don't think that I'm surprising anyone. The acting is bad, the special effects are bad to the point that they are laughable, and the story doesn't make any sense. I am aware that this movie is called Sharknado 3 so I wasn't expecting anything scientifically accurate. Sharks in space people!!!! I saw some things in this that made me question myself but like I've said, this film is called Sharknado 3 so in order to enjoy it, you just have to suspend belief and accept what you are being given. My favorite thing about the film is all the random shark kills in all their "semi-gory" glory (this is a TV movie so they can only go so far). You'll also be surprised by some of the people who get killed (no spoilers). Common sense would normally dictate not watching this but if you give it a chance you'll be pleasantly surprised and perhaps entertained as I was. I've seen the first 2 films and I enjoyed them a lot and I think that this one is the best one so far.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12465,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-07-22","keywords":"third part,creature feature,shark,space shuttle,nasa","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3641750297","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDFjYzAzMmItODRmMy00NWZjLWJkYjgtNmVjY2Y2ZDVlNDIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDFjYzAzMmItODRmMy00NWZjLWJkYjgtNmVjY2Y2ZDVlNDIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Sharknado 3: Oh Hell No!","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005575/","name":"Ian Ziering","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005346/","name":"Tara Reid","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2628561/","name":"Cassandra Scerbo"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003116/","name":"Anthony C. programme.title: Anaconda: Offspring
Anakonda 3: Potomstwo
Anaconda III
programme.desc:
Anaconda: Offspring: Directed by Don E. FauntLeRoy. With David Hasselhoff, Crystal Allen, Ryan McCluskey, Patrick Regis. A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1137996/","name":"Anaconda: Offspring","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGY5MDI5Y2ItNDk2MS00NzJlLWJmMTEtNGYwM2Y4ZjU2MjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1137996/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"player_pawn"},"dateCreated":"2008-09-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Where's the Hoff?","reviewBody":"When a film features David Hasselhoff and his crack team of snake-fighting mercenaries facing off against a 60-foot-long genetically altered anaconda before the opening credits even roll, any fan of B-movie cheese can arguably presume they're in for a good time. Hasselhoff's self-deprecating humor and strange otherworldly charm make him an endearing punchline, and also translates well into the world of Sci Fi Channel stardom. Sadly, after that opening scene, The Hoff all but disappears for the next 45 minutes of the film, and what starts with campy reptile-killin' fun quickly spirals into boring laboratory diatribes about the dangers of gene manipulation and the real-world uses of unlikely immortality drugs.

Although the ads would lead one to believe otherwise, ANACONDA III actually centers on Amanda (Crystal Allen), a scientist who works for Universal Bio-Tech and the nefariousand appropriately namedMurdoch (John Rhys-Davies, obviously still fuming over not being included in the new Indiana Jones film). It seems that he's been playing God with the reptilian world and has somehow managed to create an anaconda that's not only larger and angrier than any snake on Earth, but sports a three-foot machete growing out of its tail. This Ginsu butt comes into play numerous times during the film, and while the results are always spectacularly gory, a serpent's bladed posterior is inescapably difficult to take seriously.

Since all B-movie snakes carry the cure for (insert disease here), another round of unethical testing is underway, and it isn't long before our slithering behemoth breaks out of its cage, knocks off everyone but Amanda and her boss and heads out into the lush green wilderness of Romania. It's only then that Hasselhoff's Hammett and a group of ALIENS space-Marine rejects (resembling the United Colors of Benetton) are hired to eradicate the monster, which has taken up residence in a nearby farmhouse. With that, we've now got the prerequisite team of Special Ops, the cheap sets and the giant CG monster everything required for a yet another weak entry in the recent string of bland Sci Fi Channel originals.

Director Don E. FauntLeroy, who served as DP on the JEEPERS CREEPERS movies and nearly 50 other films, has managed to shoot a good-looking feature, but fills it with every painful cliché imaginable. First-time screenwriters Nicholas Davidoff and David Olson sprinkle in occasionally fun dialogue, but their script is ultimately burdened down with bland characters and extremely corny, uninspired plot twists. Hasselhoff's Hammett, a fun antihero who deserves more screen time (and one-liners), is delegated to a glorified supporting role beneath far less interesting characters. Rhys-Davies, whose cameo appearances work quite well, will hopefully receive a beefier role in ANACONDA IV (the direct sequel shot back to back with this movie, scheduled to debut this December); otherwise, he served virtually no purpose at all. It's only Allen as the spunky Amanda who breathes any life into her role; a surprise, given her lack of substantial film experience prior to headlining this one. Unfortunately, given the material, even she has trouble rising above the movie's stupendous mediocrity. When all is said and done, ANACONDA III should have been a much better film, but it also could have been much worse. The cast is sorely mismanaged, the plot is all over the board and the digital FXparticularly a handful of atrocious greenscreen driving shotsare by-and-large laughable, but the cast and crew obviously worked hard with what little they had. With any luck, this sequel's surviving characters will find more to do in the next entry, and we'll end up with a film that's not just meatier, but more entertaining. A direct-to-cable second follow-up to a creature feature headlined by J. Lo and Ice Cube doesn't need to be a masterpiece, but it should be passable as an evening's fleeting distraction. ANACONDA III is just barely that, but it's still regrettable that something as inherently amusing as David Hasselhoff fighting a giant snake couldn't have ended up just the slightest bit more fun.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7680,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Horror"],"datePublished":"2008-07-26","keywords":"anaconda,snakeskin,psychotronic film,woman wears a gas mask,snake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Anaconda III: Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2085683225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MDk2NDQ2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzI0OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MDk2NDQ2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzI0OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001327/","name":"David Hasselhoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1296597/","name":"Crystal Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011675/","name":"Ryan McCluskey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005703/","name":"Don E. FauntLeRoy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020879/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186146/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1682328/","name":"Nicholas Davidoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2837937/","name":"David C. Olson"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Daylight
Tunel
Daylight
programme.desc:
Daylight: Directed by Rob Cohen. With Sylvester Stallone, Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Dan Hedaya. Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0116040/","name":"Daylight","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE5MDkxYzktODU4OS00Yjc4LTk5MjktYzlkY2RjMGVlNjU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDc2NjEyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Disaster in a New York tunnel as explosions collapse both ends of it. One hero tries to help the people inside find their way to safety.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0116040/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mgsmoviesniper"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fasten your seatbelts and brace yourself for an non-stop thrill ride","reviewBody":"Fasten your seatbelts and brace yourself for an non-stop thrill ride that will have you holding your breath from start to finish.

"Daylight" is one of the most intense movies I have seen in a long time. Sylvester Stallone gives one of his best performances in "Daylight" leading a group of civilians to safety after a New York tunnel engulfs in flames. Stallone works his magic as a former EMS chief sent in to save these civilians.

When I heard Stallone's name mentioned as part of the cast of "Daylight," I knew it would be a non-stop thrill ride; however, what I didn't realize it would be a thriller that had depth mixed in with everything else. "Daylight" is a credit to Stallone's ability and this remains one of his best roles to date.

Adding to this awesome film are Stallone's co-stars, which include Amy Brenneman, Viggo Mortensen, Jay O. Sanders and Stan Shaw. I enjoyed watching this ensemble work together because they seem to need no direction when on screen. It was as if they were really trapped in the tunnel. From the fear to the heroic actions they took, these actors were top notch.

I concede that "Daylight" is predictable. However, I disagree with those who say it hurts the film. My point is it doesn't matter whether a film is predictable, rather how it is presented. "Daylight" is presented with quite unique special effects, a plot with depth and endearing performances.

In addition to the excellent performances, "Daylight" had some of the best special effects I have seen. The explosion at the beginning of the movie was a work of art. I was in awe of how well the special effects were pulled off because I don't believe that "Daylight" would have worked as well as it did if they were done with less than 100 percent effort.

"Daylight" will keep you on the edge of your seat from start to finish."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70884,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"1996-12-06","keywords":"collapsing tunnel,electronic music score,blowout,pistol,director cameo","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000312/","name":"Amy Brenneman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001557/","name":"Viggo Mortensen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003418/","name":"Rob Cohen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0062608/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092018/","name":"Leslie Bohem"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Go
Go
programme.desc: Go: Directed by Doug Liman. With Katie Holmes, Sarah Polley, Suzanne Krull, Desmond Askew. The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0139239/","name":"Go","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhNGExMDYtMWEyOS00MzMxLWJiYTYtMDYxNTRmNjdjM2VlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0139239/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"socrates4"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such Great Fun","reviewBody":"After PULP FICTION a lot of films tried to emulate its format. But none came close to matching its success. GO has clear elements of PULP FICTION in it, but it does its own thing at the same time. This is the right way to make a movie that may be inspired by another great film while still branching out on its own.\n\nThe story is great fun from the first frame to the last. The characters are fun and believable and there is a lot of great dialog here. Every time I watch it I continue to be impressed, even still after all these years. It never lets me down and it never once lets up even for a second. The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0139239/","name":"Go","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzJhNGExMDYtMWEyOS00MzMxLWJiYTYtMDYxNTRmNjdjM2VlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The aftermath of a drug deal as told from three different points of view.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0139239/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"socrates4","dateCreated":"2019-05-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such Great Fun","reviewBody":"After PULP FICTION a lot of films tried to emulate its format. But none came close to matching its success. GO has clear elements of PULP FICTION in it, but it does its own thing at the same time. This is the right way to make a movie that may be inspired by another great film while still branching out on its own.\n\nThe story is great fun from the first frame to the last. The characters are fun and believable and there is a lot of great dialog here. Every time I watch it I continue to be impressed, even still after all these years. It never lets me down and it never once lets up even for a second. Highly recommend.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70095,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1999-04-09","keywords":"multiple storyline,multiple perspectives,drugs,drug deal,sex","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Go","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1655308569","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk5ZTIzM2MtMjU3MS00ZTgwLWJkYjEtODVmZDk0N2EyNGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDk5ZTIzM2MtMjU3MS00ZTgwLWJkYjEtODVmZDk0N2EyNGVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Columbia Tristar","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001631/","name":"Sarah Polley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001542/","name":"Jay Mohr","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0937930/","name":"Scott Wolf"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510731/","name":"Doug Liman"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070311/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060034/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0041864/","name":"John August"],"duration":"PT1H42M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid
Anakondy: Polowanie na Krwawą Orchideę
Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid
programme.desc:
Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid: Directed by Dwight H. Little. With Johnny Messner, KaDee Strickland, Matthew Marsden, Nicholas Gonzalez. A scientific expedition sets out for Borneo to seek a flower called the Blood Orchid, which could grant longer life. Meanwhile, they run afoul of snakes and each other." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0366174/","name":"Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc5MDg1NTkxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTcyNjA3._V1_.jpg","description":"A scientific expedition sets out for Borneo to seek a flower called the Blood Orchid, which could grant longer life. Meanwhile, they run afoul of snakes and each other.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0366174/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"claudio_carvalho"},"dateCreated":"2007-09-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining Adventure","reviewBody":"In New York, the ambitious Dr. Jack Byron (Matthew Marsden) and his associate Gordon Mitchell (Morris Chestnut) present the research of his assistant Sam Rogers (KaDee Strickland) to the CEO and board of directors of a corporation to sponsor a scientific expedition to Borneo. The objective is to find a flower, Blood Orchid, that flourishes for a couple of weeks every seven years and could be a fountain of youth, prolonging the expectation of life of human beings. They are succeeded and once in Borneo, they realize that it is the raining season and there is no boat available to navigate on the river. They pay US$ 50,000.00 to convince Captain Bill Johnson (Johnny Messner) and his partner Tran (Karl Yune) to sail to the location. After an accident in a waterfall, the survivors realize that a pack of anacondas have gathered for mating and their nest is nearby the plantation of Blood Orchid, which made them bigger and bigger.

I saw "Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid" with a very low expectation based on the IMDb User Rating, but I liked this entertaining adventure a lot. The story is full of action and humor, and I laughed a lot when Cole calls Sam of "Lorena Babbitt" when she cuts the head of one anaconda. There are the usual clichés of this type of predictable B-movie, but I had a good surprise in the end. My vote is seven.

programme.title: Reign Over Me
Zabić wspomnienia
Reign Over Me
programme.desc:
Reign Over Me: Directed by Mike Binder. With Adam Sandler, Don Cheadle, Jada Pinkett Smith, Liv Tyler. A man who lost his family in the September 11 attack on New York City runs into his old college roommate. Rekindling the friendship is the one thing that appears able to help the man recover from his grief." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0490204/","name":"Reign Over Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTYyMTExNTgwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDY4MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A man who lost his family in the September 11 attack on New York City runs into his old college roommate. Rekindling the friendship is the one thing that appears able to help the man recover from his grief.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0490204/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2007-03-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stop Your Sobbin'","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. How rare it is for a film to examine the lost soul of men in pain. Adam Sandler stars as Charlie, a man who lost his family in the 9/11 tragedy, and has since lost his career, his reason to live and arguably, his sanity. Don Cheadle co-stars as Sandler's former Dental School roommate who appears to have the perfect life (that Sandler apparently had prior to 9/11).

Of course the parallels in these men's lives are obvious, but it is actually refreshing to see men's feelings on display in a movie ... feelings other than lust and revenge, that is. Watching how they actually help each other by just being there is painful and heartfelt. Writer/Director Mike Binder ("The Upside of Anger", and Sandler's accountant in this film) really brings a different look and feel to the film. Some of the scenes don't work as well as others, but overall it is well written and solidly directed.

Sandler and Cheadle are both excellent. Sandler's character reminds a bit of his fine performance in "Punch Drunk Love", but here he brings much more depth. Cheadle is always fine and does a nice job of expressing the burden he carries ... just by watching him work a jigsaw puzzle.

Support work is excellent by Jada Pinkett Smith (as Cheadle's wife), Liv Tyler (as a very patient psychiatrist), Saffron Burrows (in an oddly appealing role), Donald Sutherland as an irritated judge and Melinda Dillon and Robert Klein as Sandler's in-laws.

The film really touches on how the tragic events of that day affected one man so deeply that he is basically ruined. In addition to the interesting story and some great shots of NYC, you have to love any film that features vocals from Chrissy Hynde, Bruce Springsteen and Roger Daltrey ... as well as Eddie Vedder impersonating Daltrey. Not exactly a chipper upbeat film, but it is a quality film with an unusual story.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":94600,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-03-23","keywords":"grief,mental breakdown,depression,post september 11 2001,attempted suicide by cop","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Reign Over Me","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2088960281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODhmYTFlYzMtOWM5Ni00MjNmLTkyMzMtYTk2YmRlZDAyOWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODhmYTFlYzMtOWM5Ni00MjNmLTkyMzMtYTk2YmRlZDAyOWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001191/","name":"Adam Sandler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000332/","name":"Don Cheadle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000586/","name":"Jada Pinkett Smith"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0082802/","name":"Mike Binder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0204024/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028319/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0082802/","name":"Mike Binder"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

Jumanji
programme.desc:
Jumanji: Directed by Joe Johnston. With Robin Williams, Jonathan Hyde, Kirsten Dunst, Bradley Pierce. When two kids find and play a magical board game, they release a man trapped in it for decades - and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113497/","name":"Jumanji","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTk2ZmUwYmEtNTcwZS00YmMyLWFkYjMtNTRmZDA3YWExMjc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When two kids find and play a magical board game, they release a man trapped in it for decades - and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113497/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"harper_blue"},"dateCreated":"2003-09-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Action and adventure for the kids, and Robin Williams for the adults","reviewBody":"Find a comfortable chair, lay out the board, grab the dice, and get ready to play. But remember: once you start this game, you can't stop. If it takes you over twenty years to finish, finish you must.

"Jumanji" is loosely based on the Caldecott Medal-winning children's book by Chris Van Allsburg. The basic premise stays the same: a sister and brother find a strange game based on a jungle safari adventure. When they begin playing it, they find they cannot stop, for the characters and events of the game come to life and start filling their house with monkeys, lions, explorers and other strange things. Only finishing the game will make it all go away.

In the hands of Hollywood, more story is added. Now we have a game spanning 26 years, when one of the two children playing the game in 1969 gets sucked into the game itself. He's trapped there until a fresh pair of children in 1995 find the game and begin playing. The right number is rolled, and out Alan comes...as Robin Williams! Finding the grown girl to complete the group, the four must complete the game before their town is destroyed by the stampeding rhinos, killer pod vines and crazed Great White Hunter.

Robin has some good moments in this film, though he isn't allowed to riff as much as in other vehicles. He's supported by an excellent cast, including a young Kirsten Dunst as the sister of the new pair of children; Jonathan Hyde as both the 1969 father and Van Pelt, the Great White Hunter from the game; and Bebe Neuwirth as the modern children's aunt. The effects are, not surprisingly, ILM-excellent -- necessary in a film of this type. The script was co-written by Van Allsburg to insure the atmosphere of the film and book mesh, but he did not fall into the "This is MY baby" syndrome, and received good help from his two co-writers (for details, see the main page). Highly recommended for old and young alike.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":324501,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"1995-12-15","keywords":"board game,adventurer,fight,game,year 1995","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Jumanji","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2677211417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ2Njc1MGUtNDYyYi00YTQxLTk0YTYtZjkzYWRhZTAyNWM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ2Njc1MGUtNDYyYi00YTQxLTk0YTYtZjkzYWRhZTAyNWM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"text os"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000245/","name":"Robin Williams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000379/","name":"Kirsten Dunst"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001372/","name":"Bonnie Hunt"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002653/","name":"Joe Johnston"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031772/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060719/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0378144/","name":"Jonathan Hensleigh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852430/","name":"Greg Taylor"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0833164/","name":"Jim Strain"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zombieland
Zombieland
programme.desc: Zombieland: Directed by Ruben Fleischer. With Jesse Eisenberg, Woody Harrelson, Emma Stone, Abigail Breslin. A shy student trying to reach his family in Ohio, a gun-toting bruiser in search of the last Twinkie and a pair of sisters striving to get to an amusement park join forces in a trek across a zombie-filled America." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1156398/","name":"Zombieland","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5MDg0NTQ1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjA4Mjg3Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A shy student trying to reach his family in Ohio, a gun-toting bruiser in search of the last Twinkie and a pair of sisters striving to get to an amusement park join forces in a trek across a zombie-filled America.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1156398/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"KillerK1991"},"dateCreated":"2009-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"America's answer to Shaun of the Dead.","reviewBody":"This film was a fun ride all the way through. It's lack of scariness(non existent) and *GASP!* gore is more than made up for with the constant flow of hilarity and likable characters. This is by far the optimist's zombie film, as the way things play out are definitely different than any one thats come before it(definitely not a Romero flick, though I think his Land of the Dead actually is second place in this regard). It has a sleek, very modern sense of style-just watch for how each rule makes it's appearance/reappearance and a good message on the importance of others in the worst of times. I recommend this to anybody who has a remote interest in comedies, zombie/end of the world flicks, or just having a good time at the theater, and look forward to seeing it again when it comes out.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":544496,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2010-01-06","keywords":"zombie,amusement park,twinkie,on the road,actor playing himself","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The "Kick-Ass Girls" of Zombieland","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi179635481","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTc4Nzc0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODg5MjI5Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NTc4Nzc0NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODg5MjI5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Zombieland featurette"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0251986/","name":"Jesse Eisenberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1297015/","name":"Emma Stone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000437/","name":"Woody Harrelson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281508/","name":"Ruben Fleischer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142539/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1014201/","name":"Rhett Reese"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1116660/","name":"Paul Wernick"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Whole Nine Yards
Jak ugryźć 10 milionów
The Whole Nine Yards
programme.desc: The Whole Nine Yards: Directed by Jonathan Lynn. With Bruce Willis, Matthew Perry, Rosanna Arquette, Michael Clarke Duncan. A struggling dentist's life is turned upside down when a famous gangster moves in next door, and his wife convinces him to inform a notorious mob boss about the gangster's whereabouts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0190138/","name":"The Whole Nine Yards","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4Nzk4NzU4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzU0MDc3._V1_.jpg","description":"A struggling dentist's life is turned upside down when a famous gangster moves in next door, and his wife convinces him to inform a notorious mob boss about the gangster's whereabouts.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0190138/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Special-K88"},"dateCreated":"2002-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"lots of laughs, surprises, and spirited performances","reviewBody":"Perry is an unhappy dentist stuck in a dead marriage and burdened with financial problems; as if that isn't bad enough, he learns that his new neighbor is in fact an infamous contract killer with reprehensible mob ties. Against his better judgment, Perry decides to try and rat out the lowlife for his own personal gain, but soon gets in over his head. The film's humor is occasionally too silly for words, but the cast is good and full of enthusiasm—especially Peet—and the script throws out a lot of unexpected twists and turns at just the right moments. Surprising and very funny, with a perfect part for Willis who finds just the right tone for a gangster with heart. ***"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116792,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2000-02-18","keywords":"hitman,adultery,marriage problems,nudity,bare breasts","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4278959641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJlYjBjNWItOTUwMi00NGY0LWI5ZWMtMmQ4ZDhkZTZkMWFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJlYjBjNWItOTUwMi00NGY0LWI5ZWMtMmQ4ZDhkZTZkMWFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001612/","name":"Matthew Perry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000275/","name":"Rosanna Arquette"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0528718/","name":"Jonathan Lynn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026797/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0140758/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438449/","name":"Mitchell Kapner"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

A struggling dentist's life is turned upside down when a famous gangster moves in next door, and his wife convinces him to inform a notorious mob boss about the gangster's whereabouts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0190138/","name":"The Whole Nine Yards","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4Nzk4NzU4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzU0MDc3._V1_.jpg","description":"A struggling dentist's life is turned upside down when a famous gangster moves in next door, and his wife convinces him to inform a notorious mob boss about the gangster's whereabouts.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0190138/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Special-K88","dateCreated":"2002-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"lots of laughs, surprises, and spirited performances","reviewBody":"Perry is an unhappy dentist stuck in a dead marriage and burdened with financial problems; as if that isn't bad enough, he learns that his new neighbor is in fact an infamous contract killer with reprehensible mob ties. Against his better judgment, Perry decides to try and rat out the lowlife for his own personal gain, but soon gets in over his head. The film's humor is occasionally too silly for words, but the cast is good and full of enthusiasm—especially Peet—and the script throws out a lot of unexpected twists and turns at just the right moments. Surprising and very funny, with a perfect part for Willis who finds just the right tone for a gangster with heart. ***","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116792,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2000-02-18","keywords":"hitman,adultery,marriage problems,nudity,bare breasts","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4278959641","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJlYjBjNWItOTUwMi00NGY0LWI5ZWMtMmQ4ZDhkZTZkMWFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTJlYjBjNWItOTUwMi00NGY0LWI5ZWMtMmQ4ZDhkZTZkMWFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000246/","name":"Bruce Willis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001612/","name":"Matthew Perry","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000275/","name":"Rosanna Arquette"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0528718/","name":"Jonathan Lynn"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026797/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0140758/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438449/","name":"Mitchell Kapner"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kick-Ass 2
Naznaczony: rozdział 2
Insidious: Chapter 2
programme.desc:
Kick-Ass 2: Directed by Jeff Wadlow. With Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloë Grace Moretz, Morris Chestnut, Claudia Lee. Following Kick-Ass' heroics, other citizens are inspired to become masked crusaders. But Red Mist leads his own group of evil supervillains to get revenge, kill Kick-Ass and destroy everything he stands for." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1650554/","name":"Kick-Ass 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4OTQxNzc0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTQxOTU5OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Following Kick-Ass' heroics, other citizens are inspired to become masked crusaders. But Red Mist leads his own group of evil supervillains to get revenge, kill Kick-Ass and destroy everything he stands for.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1650554/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Vartiainen"},"dateCreated":"2014-01-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lacks the novelty and the charm of the original","reviewBody":"If the first Kick-Ass movie was that cool cousin, who's a bit rough around the edges and definitely a badass, then this film is that young brat, who tries to imitate said cousin, but only partly succeeds.

The first Kick-Ass film had a few good things going for it. It had a completely new take on the superhero genre, it skillfully juggled both effective comedy and brutally violent action scenes, plus it had some pretty convincing characters and a dark storyline. The sequel, on the other hand, fails at the juggling part. The action scenes are still pretty brutal and effective, but the humour lacks that razor sharp edge that made the first one so believable despite its premise. Instead it relies on racial stereotypes and potty humour, which just isn't that funny.

Add in a lackluster storyline that honestly feels like watching tennis. First one character has a change of heart, then few minutes later he/she bounces back and another character decides to change his/her opinion, immediately after which the first one changes his/her stand. Rinse and repeat. A compelling and captivating story this does not make, especially when the villain generates mostly embarrassed facepalms and the final battle rejuvenates some of the first clichés the first film so artfully dodged.

That being said, the production values are still excellent, some of the new characters are pretty interesting (though there's way too many of them), I still like both Kick-Ass (Aaron Taylor-Johnson) and Hit-Girl (Chloë Grace Moretz) and they had some really good scenes together. If you liked the first film and want to see the storyline continued, this one is worth checking out if you're not expecting miracles.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":262717,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2013-09-11","keywords":"superhero,high school,vigilante,kicked in the crotch,punched in the crotch","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Comic-Con Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1509927193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY1MjQ0MTYxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc0Nzk4OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjY1MjQ0MTYxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc0Nzk4OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":" 	The costumed high-school hero Kick-Ass joins with a group of normal citizens who have been inspired to fight crime in costume. Meanwhile, the Red Mist plots an act of revenge that will affect everyone Kick-Ass knows."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1093951/","name":"Aaron Taylor-Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1631269/","name":"Chloë Grace Moretz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2395586/","name":"Christopher Mintz-Plasse"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0905592/","name":"Jeff Wadlow"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165404/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0169264/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0905592/","name":"Jeff Wadlow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2092839/","name":"Mark Millar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1348210/","name":"John Romita Jr."}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: After Earth
1000 lat po Ziemi
After Earth
programme.desc:
After Earth: Directed by M. Night Shyamalan. With Jaden Smith, Will Smith, Sophie Okonedo, Zoë Kravitz. A crash landing leaves Kitai Raige and his father Cypher stranded on Earth, a millennium after events forced humanity's escape. With Cypher injured, Kitai must embark on a perilous journey to signal for help." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1815862/","name":"After Earth","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3MzQyMjkwMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDk2OTE0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A crash landing leaves Kitai Raige and his father Cypher stranded on Earth, a millennium after events forced humanity's escape. With Cypher injured, Kitai must embark on a perilous journey to signal for help.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1815862/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"njdaymond89"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"This isn't THAT bad, why the hate?!","reviewBody":"I must have missed the 'everyone say crap about this film' meeting, After Earth is quite simply NOT as bad as the majority of reviewers are implying?! I'm not biased, I don't worship any of the actors but I do know my films and can appreciate them even when they're not what I anticipated!

I sat and read about 15 reviews before deciding I wanted to go and see this film anyway, and happy I did. I'm a sci-fi fan so when films include the sounds of a spaceships engines... in umm... space, well that annoys me. But I could forgive After Earth for this and it's other negatives because it's not a hardcore sci-fi, even if it somewhat tried to be in places.

Will Smith is very monotone throughout, correct. Jaden Smith is probably a few years away from this role working fully for him, correct. There are some question marks over the uncomplicated and slightly predictable plot and cheap looking set design in places, correct. But it was good escapism fun for an hour and a half and worth seeing on the big screen.

I won't deny, there could have been improvements and big alterations in many places to the point that this could have been an 8/10 from me, but it works on the level it chose to be at. Considering Will Smith had near full control of this project - writing the script, coaching his son's performance, personally hiring M Night Shyamalan (but only for basic directing) - this film is good for what it is.

Had it come before Star Trek, Oblivion and Cloud Atlas this year and if M Night Shyamalan didn't have a bad rep then I think this film would be at the 6.5/10 rating that I think it deserves.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":196554,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2013-05-31","keywords":"real life father and son playing father and son,post apocalypse,future,space voyage,fear","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2277418521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzMjY3OTkzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzkyNzQyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUzMjY3OTkzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzkyNzQyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After Earth After a crash landing, a father and son explore a planet that was evacuated by humans 1,000 years earlier. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1535523/","name":"Jaden Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0219292/","name":"David Denman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0796117/","name":"M. programme.title: Arrival
Nowy początek
Arrival
programme.desc: Arrival: Directed by Denis Villeneuve. With Amy Adams, Jeremy Renner, Forest Whitaker, Michael Stuhlbarg. A linguist works with the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecraft appear around the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2543164/","name":"Arrival","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTExMzU0ODcxNDheQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDE1OTI4MzAy._V1_.jpg","description":"A linguist works with the military to communicate with alien lifeforms after twelve mysterious spacecraft appear around the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2543164/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SilentEyes_"},"dateCreated":"2017-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"No CGI overkill, just some fine acting and directing","reviewBody":"Denis Villeneuve is without a doubt an upcoming director and I can't wait to see Blade Runner 2049. Prisoners, Sicario and now Arrival (haven't seen Enemy yet, or some of his earlier work). Denis knows how to capture the tension. It is almost the strongest point of all of his films. Minimal use of computer generated images, and main focus on story, characters, acting and thrilling scenes. Back on IMDb board, I have noticed a lot of people calling Arrival a boring movie. So many hypocrites these days. People trying to point out every possible flaw to look and sound smarter while at the same time hailing far worse movies. Calling it boring and slow while at the same time complaining no originality in Hollywood, only giant CGI laser explosions extravaganza. Go watch Independence Day. In Arrival there is no action, no explosions, just some amazing acting performances combined with good directing, editing and cinematography. There was not a single moment I felt bored.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":639206,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-11-11","keywords":"alien contact,linguistics,linguist,nonlinear timeline,based on short story","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Final Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4225807897","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA4Mzg5OTY5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDk4ODg0MDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA4Mzg5OTY5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDk4ODg0MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A linguist is recruited by the military to assist in translating alien communications."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010736/","name":"Amy Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0719637/","name":"Jeremy Renner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001845/","name":"Forest Whitaker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0898288/","name":"Denis Villeneuve"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296971/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251858/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0158853/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2104063/","name":"Eric Heisserer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5384213/","name":"Ted Chiang"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Resident Evil
Resident Evil: Afterlife
programme.desc:
Resident Evil: Directed by Paul W.S. Anderson. With Ryan McCluskey, Oscar Pearce, Indra Ové, Anna Bolt. A special military unit fights a powerful, out-of-control supercomputer and hundreds of scientists who have mutated into flesh-eating creatures after a laboratory accident." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120804/","name":"Resident Evil","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmI1ZGRhNDYtOGVjZC00MmUyLThlNTktMTQyZGE3MzE1ZTdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDE5MTU2MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A special military unit fights a powerful, out-of-control supercomputer and hundreds of scientists who have mutated into flesh-eating creatures after a laboratory accident.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120804/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Zod-2"},"dateCreated":"2002-10-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprisingly Entertaining","reviewBody":"I was generally surprised that I liked this movie, not being a fan of either of it's stars. I decided to give the movie a try since it does deal with one of my favorite horror topics...zombies!

As a horror movie Resident Evil fails miserably, it's not scary and contains only small amounts of suspense. It is much better as an action film although much of the action is chaotic, accompanied by lame heavy metal/thrash music. But seeing as it is based on a video game and made primarily for teenage boy video game addicts it is quite good in and of itself.

The movie plays well, even though it is apparent that some scenes have been cut to achieve an R-rating. The characters do what they need to do in order to survive.

One small problem with the movie is the relative lack of zombie screen time. They do appear in two major scenes but most of the time the hallways are clear. This hive was supposed to employ thousands of people but you only ever see 100 zombies at the most. Also, the humans seem to be able to travel easily wherever they have to go until it is time for another action sequence. It would have been better if they constantly ran into single zombies which they were able to easily dispose of, but this is nit-picking on my part.

Overall I enjoyed the movie and I have never seen, let alone played, the video game. I'm not sure if this movie will have the staying power over multiple viewings for me (like Aliens) but it's a very good single viewing action picture. programme.review: --- Actors: Ryan McCluskey (role=Mr. Grey), Oscar Pearce (role=Mr. Red), Indra Ové (role=Ms. Black), Anna Bolt (role=Dr. Green), Joseph May (role=Dr. Blue), Robert Tannion (role=Dr. Brown), Heike Makatsch (role=Lisa), Jaymes Butler (role=Clarence), Stephen Billington (role=Mr. White), Fiona Glascott (role=Ms. Gold), Milla Jovovich (role=Alice), Eric Mabius (role=Matt)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0120804, Title: Resident Evil, --- Description: Resident Evil: Directed by Paul W.S. Anderson. With Ryan McCluskey, Oscar Pearce, Indra Ové, Anna Bolt. A special military unit fights a powerful, out-of-control supercomputer and hundreds of scientists who have mutated into flesh-eating creatures after a laboratory accident." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120804/","name":"Resident Evil","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmI1ZGRhNDYtOGVjZC00MmUyLThlNTktMTQyZGE3MzE1ZTdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDE5MTU2MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A special military unit fights a powerful, out-of-control supercomputer and hundreds of scientists who have mutated into flesh-eating creatures after a laboratory accident.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120804/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Zod-2","dateCreated":"2002-10-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Surprisingly Entertaining","reviewBody":"I was generally surprised that I liked this movie, not being a fan of either of it's stars. I decided to give the movie a try since it does deal with one of my favorite horror topics...zombies!

As a horror movie Resident Evil fails miserably, it's not scary and contains only small amounts of suspense. It is much better as an action film although much of the action is chaotic, accompanied by lame heavy metal/thrash music. But seeing as it is based on a video game and made primarily for teenage boy video game addicts it is quite good in and of itself.

The movie plays well, even though it is apparent that some scenes have been cut to achieve an R-rating. The characters do what they need to do in order to survive.

One small problem with the movie is the relative lack of zombie screen time. They do appear in two major scenes but most of the time the hallways are clear. This hive was supposed to employ thousands of people but you only ever see 100 zombies at the most. Also, the humans seem to be able to travel easily wherever they have to go until it is time for another action sequence. It would have been better if they constantly ran into single zombies which they were able to easily dispose of, but this is nit-picking on my part.

Overall I enjoyed the movie and I have never seen, let alone played, the video game. I'm not sure if this movie will have the staying power over multiple viewings for me (like Aliens) but it's a very good single viewing action picture. Easily the best movie I have seen based on a video game. Despite it's flaws Resident Evil rates a 7 out of 10, if taken more seriously this could have been a really good movie. It would have been nice to see a George Romero version.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":257871,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2002-08-28","keywords":"doberman,cut into pieces,zombie,commando,kissing while having sex","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Resident Evil","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2894266649","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjI4NDZjNWUtNDBkMy00ZTY5LWJkMjEtMmFhZWIxZjAyZjMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjI4NDZjNWUtNDBkMy00ZTY5LWJkMjEtMmFhZWIxZjAyZjMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Tristar","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000170/","name":"Milla Jovovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735442/","name":"Michelle Rodriguez","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011675/","name":"Ryan McCluskey"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027271/","name":"Paul W.S. A place forgotten by everyone, including the creatures that inhabit the Earth... until now." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3467412/","name":"Extinction","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzMzIyMTQ3N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTMzNTAwNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"And suddenly, overnight, the world came to a halt. Two men, two survivors, one kid, and hatred that separates them. A place forgotten by everyone, including the creatures that inhabit the Earth... until now.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3467412/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"coffeyn-10202"},"dateCreated":"2015-07-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not Bad","reviewBody":"I just finished watching this film, fair enough it is you average run of the mill type. I however enjoyed the movie, I would say watch it and make your own mind up. The effects were good and the acting to, CGI was excellent not tacky low budget. I have seen far worse in the past, however this film is not one of them. I would watch it again, so saying that says something. If your expecting scares, jumps etc, whilst there are a few, it is very drawn out, the story gets you involved with the characters which is good, If I have to say this film sort of reminds me of legend with will smith, no doubt some people will not like it but hey better than watching paint dry.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16678,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2015-07-31","keywords":"father daughter relationship,zombie apocalypse,zombie,epidemic,post apocalypse","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Extinction","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1221702425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDIwZjE2MTgtNTMyNC00NGNjLWJmMWUtZTIxNzg0OTA3MDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDIwZjE2MTgtNTMyNC00NGNjLWJmMWUtZTIxNzg0OTA3MDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Extinction"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0289142/","name":"Matthew Fox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0232998/","name":"Jeffrey Donovan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3824412/","name":"Quinn McColgan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0900251/","name":"Miguel Ángel Vivas"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0123200/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0320014/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157609/","name":"Alberto Marini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0900251/","name":"Miguel Ángel Vivas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5363153/","name":"Juan de Dios Garduño"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Baiohazado: Damuneshon
Resident Evil: Potępienie
Biohazard: Damnation
programme.desc: Baiohazado: Damuneshon: Directed by Makoto Kamiya. With Matthew Mercer, Dave Wittenberg, Wendee Lee, Val Tasso. Special Agent Leon S.Kennedy goes against his superior's orders and works to destroy a series of biological weapons being used in a war zone in Europe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1753496/","name":"Baiohazado: Damuneshon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDY2M2RkMmMtNGY3Yy00MTg0LWJmMmItNjEzODJjYTViZjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Special Agent Leon S.Kennedy goes against his superior's orders and works to destroy a series of biological weapons being used in a war zone in Europe.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1753496/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nhatlamsokul"},"dateCreated":"2012-09-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Best resident evil movie yet!!!","reviewBody":"I can't say anything more! it's amazing to me that Capcom and Sony have brought the best movie of the series to all of us, and importantly the fans of the video game. Resident Evil Damnation was a spectacular breakthrough, more interesting and better than RE: Degeneration. The Effect and CG was great to me, it showed the monsters extremely vividly, beautiful slow-motions. You must keep your eyes open all almost 2hrs because of the very-fast rhythm and nice action of Leon and Ada. programme.title: Kazdy ma swoje lato
Każdy ma swoje lato
programme.desc: Kazdy ma swoje lato: Directed by Tomasz Jurkiewicz. With Nicolas Przygoda, Anita Poddebniak, Maciej Grzybowski, Sandra Drzymalska. The rebellious Agata comes to a small town to cook in an oasis. Seventeen-year-old Mirek, the son of a local organist, falls in love with her, and his grandfather, suffering from dementia, sees the girl as a lover from her youth. Mirek takes advantage of his grandfather's illness to get closer to Agata. With Robert Olech, Piotr Glowacki, Cezary Lukaszewicz, Martyna Peszko." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479261/","name":"Rozdroze Cafe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGJjYTU2NWQtZmUzNy00YTA5LWE3NWMtZDUzNzhiYTIyMGQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479261/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"temporarybobi"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well done","reviewBody":"I saw this film in Krakow's Kino Pod Baranami. Film was well done. It depicts the misunderstandings among some young polish provincial people, who have the ambitions to crop up in the new post-communist, re-capitalist society.

While the young women in the film are trying to escape the disconsolately life by either getting know established oldsters or by giving birth to numerous children, the young men decide to rob a bank. Things get wrong, one of the guys flips out and kills four people.

The film is supposed to be based on a true story which has happened for about 3-4 years in Warsaw. The screenplay makes use of many clichés, otherwise film is well done."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":143,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-11-11","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2027064/","name":"Robert Olech"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1644158/","name":"Piotr Glowacki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2021835/","name":"Cezary Lukaszewicz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0479261, Title: Rozdroze Cafe, --- Description: Rozdroze Cafe: Directed by Leszek Wosiewicz. With Robert Olech, Piotr Glowacki, Cezary Lukaszewicz, Martyna Peszko." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0479261/","name":"Rozdroze Cafe","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGJjYTU2NWQtZmUzNy00YTA5LWE3NWMtZDUzNzhiYTIyMGQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0479261/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"temporarybobi","dateCreated":"2005-11-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Well done","reviewBody":"I saw this film in Krakow's Kino Pod Baranami. Film was well done. It depicts the misunderstandings among some young polish provincial people, who have the ambitions to crop up in the new post-communist, re-capitalist society.

While the young women in the film are trying to escape the disconsolately life by either getting know established oldsters or by giving birth to numerous children, the young men decide to rob a bank. Things get wrong, one of the guys flips out and kills four people.

The film is supposed to be based on a true story which has happened for about 3-4 years in Warsaw. The screenplay makes use of many clichés, otherwise film is well done.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":143,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-11-11","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2027064/","name":"Robert Olech","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1644158/","name":"Piotr Glowacki","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2021835/","name":"Cezary Lukaszewicz"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941829/","name":"Leszek Wosiewicz"],"duration":"PT1H52M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Un homme pressé
Drugie życie pana Alaina
Un homme pressé
programme.desc:
Un homme pressé: Directed by Hervé Mimran. With Fabrice Luchini, Leïla Bekhti, Rebecca Marder, Igor Gotesman. A high profile businessman has let his personal life lapse in favor of corporate success. When he suffers a serious stroke he finds himself stripped back to zero. He learns to rebuild his life with the help of a therapist and his family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6948326/","name":"Un homme pressé","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjU1MGQyN2MtYjIyMC00YTVkLTlmMWUtZThiOTJiOTQxYTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjY1OTM1Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A high profile businessman has let his personal life lapse in favor of corporate success. When he suffers a serious stroke he finds himself stripped back to zero. He learns to rebuild his life with the help of a therapist and his fam","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6948326/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"spookyrat1"},"dateCreated":"2020-10-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cleverly Acted One Joke Dramedy!","reviewBody":"Herve Mimran's A Man in a Hurry is a little unusual, in that it takes the serious subject of strokes, then subtracts most of the dramatic repercussions of an onset of the illness, substituting comedic elements instead. This plays out singularly in that high-powered, workaholic CEO of a car company, Alain (Fabrice Luchini), wakes up in hospital to discover that he's forgotten how to use his native French language. He knows exactly what he wants to say but can't choose the right words to say it. It's funny for awhile, until it becomes a repetitious contrivance, as we gradually understand there are no other stroke side effects to be explored. This is not to take anything away from Luchini's very good performance. His enunciation and timing of the jumbled words and sentences is impeccable.

The movie then morphs into a fairly innocuous, but derivative tale of personal redemption, as the vocally - challenged executive, loses his job, whilst slowly coming to the gradual realisation, that there is more to life than work.

Seemingly recognising that he really only had the slim pickings of a major narrative with A Man in a Hurry, Mimran confusingly chooses to add in a few other fairly extensive sub-stories involving support characters. Of these, the only one that really seems to mesh, even partly with the main storyline is that which involves Alain's alienated daughter, who like her dad, is pursuing her university course single - mindedly, with little time for much else.

Another sub-story involving speech therapist Jeanne (Leila Bekhti) even becomes a little creepy, when for awhile it appears Alain, may be contemplating some sort of romantic overtones with Jeanne, who is all of half his age and may be more. It's an odd storyline that feels better suited to a completely different film.

One aspect the movie succeeds quite well with, is underlining the therapeutic benefits of animals. Alain's cute dog Sam, pointedly remains faithful, to his master, even when many of his human colleagues abandon any form of relationship with the fallen CEO. These inter-species relationships are further played up in visits to zoos and parks.

The film's third act features some very attractive on - location visuals, that differ markedly from the film's earlier urban settings, as Alain, accompanied by Sam, attempts to sort his priorities out whilst adopting the mantle of a peregrino, taking on the famous Camino di Santiago extended walking trip between France and Spain.

This is a light, frothy, entirely forgettable, feel good piece that plays out longer than it should. That Alain eventually comes out on top, regaining much of his humanity, should not be much of a surprise to anyone. It's a pity that it takes such an unbalanced, circuitous route in getting there. 5.5/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1507,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-11-07","keywords":"reference to montgomery clift,reference to gregory peck,reference to peter lorre,reference to humphrey bogart,vehicle design","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi247118361","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlZjNlMzctY2I3Yi00ZmE2LTgwZTQtYzM4ZDAzMmFmNzkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlZjNlMzctY2I3Yi00ZmE2LTgwZTQtYzM4ZDAzMmFmNzkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524528/","name":"Fabrice Luchini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1871951/","name":"Leïla Bekhti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2406198/","name":"Rebecca Marder"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1773597/","name":"Hervé Mimran"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315631/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172053/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1773597/","name":"Hervé Mimran"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277229/","name":"Hélène Fillières"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7013534/","name":"Christian Streiff"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="
